column13: This year, Endeavour performed a waste audit to understand better its waste streams and current waste practices at its Retail stores and Hotels to optimise how Endeavour diverts waste from landfills. The waste stream figures will inform Endeavour's waste strategy in F24.
column20: Waste audit, waste stream, waste practice

column6: Management of significant waste-related impacts
column13: This year, Endeavour's team took part in the Plastic Free July (PFJ) initiative, a way for its team members to set personal plastic-free goals at home and work. Many choose to refuse single-use items for July and beyond. Plastic Free July is a global movement to change behaviour and reduce waste in landfills by focusing on small steps that make a big difference.
column20: Plastic Free July, plastic-free goal, single-use item

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: Endeavour's employment policies, practices and standards are focused on its team's safety, health and well-being. These are implemented and overseen by an experienced Safety, Health and Well-being team, reviewed regularly by the Executive Leadership Team, and are externally audited against best practices. Endeavour's safety performance and metrics are reviewed quarterly by the People, Culture and Performance Committee.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: F23 saw the continuation of Endeavour's internal Safety and Health Audit Program. 5% of Endeavour's sites will be audited in each business unit with a coverage review annually as part of the internal audit plan, ensuring its health and safety management systems remain certified to the National Self-Insurer Audit Tool.
column20: Safety and Health Audit Program, business unit, internal audit

column6: Occupational health services
column13: Endeavour cares deeply about the safety and well-being of its team, families, and communities. Since 2022, more than 9,000 team members have participated in family and domestic violence awareness training developed in close consultation with the national sexual assault, domestic and family violence counselling service 1800RESPECT. The training helps team members determine what constitutes domestic and family violence, what to do if they see signs of abuse, how to report it, and the support systems in place.

column6: Occupational health services
column13: In F23, Endeavour took a holistic approach to providing support with the launch of Endeavour Well-being and Support, a consolidated banner for Endeavour's programs and initiatives, including physical and mental health support and outreach services, as well as financial planning and career guidance.
column20: Endeavour Well-being and Support, mental health support, career guidance

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
Worker training on occupational health and safety
Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: Endeavour works to build support capability internally, with 288 of its team members, including State Operations Leads and Hotel Venue Managers, completing Mental Health First Aid training. This training is focused on how to assist a team member who may be experiencing a mental health problem or mental health crisis until appropriate professional help is received or the crisis is resolved.
column20: Mental Health First Aid training, support capability, mental health problem

column6: Promotion of worker health
Promotion of worker health
column13: As part of its commitment to the safety of its team, customers, and communities, in F23, Endeavour partnered with the charity initiative Heart of the Nation. It installed 275 Automated External Defibrillator (AED) units in every Dan Murphy store across Australia. Endeavour proudly displaying the Heart of the Nation sticker indicates that in the event of someone experiencing a sudden cardiac arrest, a defibrillator on-site can be used to save a life.
column20: Heart of the Nation, charity initiative, cardiac arrest

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: Endeavour's Well-being Calendar offers its team well-being prompts each month, covering a range of physical, mental, emotional, community and financial well-being topics and encouraging its team to prioritise overall well-being. For example, during September's focus on psychological well-being, team members are offered access to a library of resources and materials on mental health and encouraged to participate in initiatives such as 'R U OK Day'.
column20: Well-being Calendar, well-being prompt, well-being topic

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: This year, Endeavour implemented two key initiatives focused on reducing manual handling and burn injuries associated with hotel oil management. All stainless steel pots bigger than 18 litres have now been removed from Endeavour's kitchens, as historically, they were being used to remove and transport hot oil from fryers. Endeavour also installed PitCo self-filtering fryers to reduce manual handling. In F24, Endeavour will begin a phased roll-out of vacuum waste tanks for these fryers to reduce further the risk of team members being exposed to hot oil.
column20: Manual handling injury reduction, stainless steel pot, PitCo
